intro: Mecodium crispatum, commonly known as the hairy mecodium, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its upright, branched stems and opposite, ovate leaves. The plant produces small, tubular flowers that are typically pale blue to purple in color. It thrives in well-drained soil and full sun, making it a suitable choice for rock gardens or dry landscapes. Due to its ornamental value and unique foliage, it is often cultivated in botanical gardens.
